document.heading: Board of Real Property Assessments and Appeals Reform Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-159, the “Board of Real Property Assessments and Appeals Reform Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-228 which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 2, 2006, and June 6, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 26, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-400 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-159 became effective on September 19, 2006.
